channel.title: Gaming Desktop
channel.description:
K so, currently down to 3 options (even though one has gone out of stock since I have posted this, probably meaning I should have got it haha)
Both of these seem to be able to play BF3 on Ultra and the first is $100 cheaper. Is it worth spending the extra $100 or no? 1st Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883227461 2nd Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883227460
Also the first one has 1TB hard drive compared to 500GB in the second, and the first has i7 compared to i5 in the second. And the first is $100 cheaper!? Am I missing something lol?
3rd Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439 -16gb ram, 2tb harddrive, and good processor at 4.0GHz, except it is AMD

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:58, topic:520158”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=638651.msg4305878#msg4305878 date=1369786793]

How fragmented your drives are will not affect your framerate…

So even if I have a lot of files it shouldn’t affect my gameplay?
[/quote]Correct. It can affect your game loading speed if your drives are extremely fragmented, but it shouldn’t affect your in-game speed or anything.[/quote]
Okay that’s more than fine. I never have that much on my hard drive and when I do I delete it after a short period.

Read full topic

How fragmented your drives are will not affect your framerate…
[/quote]
So even if I have a lot of files it shouldn’t affect my gameplay?[/quote]Correct. It can affect your game loading speed if your drives are extremely fragmented, but it shouldn’t affect your in-game speed or anything.

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:55, topic:520158”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=638651.msg4305827#msg4305827 date=1369779114]
How fragmented your drives are will not affect your framerate…
[/quote]
So even if I have a lot of files it shouldn’t affect my gameplay?[/quote]

Ram, Processor, Graphics Card
A hard drive has little to nothing to do with performance, it only contains files that are accessible.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:52, topic:520158”]Sigh… absolutely nothing to do with how much you have on your hard drive whatsoever, unless it’s fragmented as fuck.

Mine will boot to desktop in under 8 seconds and load games almost instantly, and I can tell you my frame rate certainly isn’t affected.

[/quote]and…you have a ssd hence the quick boot.

yes everytime you add more stuff to your harddrive it means more space that will have to be defragged later.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Sigh… absolutely nothing to do with how much you have on your hard drive whatsoever.

Mine will boot to desktop in under 8 seconds and load games almost instantly, and I can tell you my frame rate certainly isn’t affected.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

Loveandpower:

As long as you don’t clog your computer up with movies/videos I think it will be perfectly fine to run ultra.

Well I’ll try to delete them at a regular basis so it doesn’t get too clogged but I can’t see it going over like 100GB of movies/videos.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:48, topic:520158”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=638651.msg4305659#msg4305659 date=1369751879]

I’m not finding much at a reasonable price searching on my own, and that sounds very expensive CJ

Well your personal requirements are pretty high what do you expect?

A GTX 650 is not going to be enough if you want this on ultra, especially if you want 60FPS+
Edit: here, @ 1920x1080 the GTX 650 gets an average of 41FPS on the low preset.
http://www.tomshardware.com/reviews/geforce-gtx-660-geforce-gtx-650-benchmark,3297-7.html

Honestly, go look at the game benchmarks…

Trust me BF3 is pretty much the only game I play, I have a GTX 680 and I average 90 FPS on ultra @ 1920x1080

All the videos I saw of the GTX 650 were playing it on Ultra and 1080p and the 650 is much cheaper, so those 3 options I listed were all able to play on Ultra 1080p, but I really don’t know which one to get of those 3.

EDIT: Lol one of the ones I already listed is out of stock -.-

Prolly gonna go with this one http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439
[/quote]that AMD will do perfectly fine Just keep in mind that overtime in the sense of how long you let a game run at one time the intel hardware will perform best.[/quote]
So if I don’t play for 5 consecutive hours on the same game, I will be fine?

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:39, topic:520158”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=638651.msg4305582#msg4305582 date=1369732007]

I’m not finding much at a reasonable price searching on my own, and that sounds very expensive CJ

Well your personal requirements are pretty high what do you expect?

A GTX 650 is not going to be enough if you want this on ultra, especially if you want 60FPS+
Edit: here, @ 1920x1080 the GTX 650 gets an average of 41FPS on the low preset.

Tom's Hardware – 13 Sep 12

Benchmark Results: Battlefield 3 - Nvidia GeForce GTX 650 And 660 Review: Kepler...

Sub-$150 cards like the GeForce GTX 650 can only handle Battlefield 3's Low detail preset, which is a little disappointing. The resulting image quality still looks good, though, and is at least intensive enough to tax these boards. AMD's Radeo...

Honestly, go look at the game benchmarks…

Trust me BF3 is pretty much the only game I play, I have a GTX 680 and I average 90 FPS on ultra @ 1920x1080
[/quote]
All the videos I saw of the GTX 650 were playing it on Ultra and 1080p and the 650 is much cheaper, so those 3 options I listed were all able to play on Ultra 1080p, but I really don’t know which one to get of those 3.

EDIT: Lol one of the ones I already listed is out of stock -.-

Prolly gonna go with this one http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439[/quote]that AMD will do perfectly fine Just keep in mind that overtime in the sense of how long you let a game run at one time the intel hardware will perform best.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

marcbob:

All the videos I saw of the GTX 650 were playing it on Ultra and 1080p and the 650 is much cheaper, so those 3 options I listed were all able to play on Ultra 1080p, but I really don’t know which one to get of those 3.

Sure, at 720p (1280x720) it’ll average a measly 35 FPS… who the hell plays at 720p though? Or at 35 FPS? That fps always looks nice in videos, soon as you’re in the game it seems laggy as anything

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“ArmorCroc, post:45, topic:520158”]Maaaan, the 3rd option is the way to go! The price class is really close to building one yourself! I got this FX-8350, not that hardly OC’ed and it’s the bomb! The motherboard I don’t think is the best one (I bought the most expensive one I got my hands on from AMD, the Crosshair V Formula-Z) but it does exactly the job there, the only thing with a little down is the memory I think. I clocked my 2400 MHz 16 Gb to the basic max, before the mem upgrade I had these 4 x 2 Gbs @ 1866 Mhz and found them as a bottle neck. Might be nobody even read this far but bahh…

The conclusion of my confusious thoughts: I highly suggest the http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439 (3rd option, right?)[/quote]
Yeah that’s the third option. That’s the one I’m going with atm.

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @ArmorCroc ArmorCroc
item.description:
@ArmorCroc wrote:

Maaaan, the 3rd option is the way to go! The price class is really close to building one yourself! I got this FX-8350, not that hardly OC’ed and it’s the bomb! The motherboard I don’t think is the best one (I bought the most expensive one I got my hands on from AMD, the Crosshair V Formula-Z) but it does exactly the job there, the only thing with a little down is the memory I think. I clocked my 2400 MHz 16 Gb to the basic max, before the mem upgrade I had these 4 x 2 Gbs @ 1866 Mhz and found them as a bottle neck. Might be nobody even read this far but bahh…

The conclusion of my confusious thoughts: I highly suggest the http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439 (3rd option, right?)

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @Cyberus Cyberus
item.description:
@Cyberus wrote:

[quote=“marcbob, post:43, topic:520158”][quote author=Cyberus link=topic=638651.msg4305691#msg4305691 date=1369762053]

The one I posted outperforms that one in every way (besides memory, but even just 8gb is overkill for gaming) and is ~$250 cheaper.

I don’t want to build one. I doubt I even could unless it’s easier than I think.

It’s easier than you’d think. I know people who were literally 12 when they built theirs. There are plenty of great video tutorials that can help you out. It’ll save you money for better equipment and you’ll get a free education out of it.

[/quote]
I’ll consider it but what you linked to seems like worse stuff for a lower price so idk
http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439 Is pretty good idk[/quote]
The i5 3570k shits on the bulldozer series and the 7870 outperforms the 660. There is nothing better in that computer other than maybe more storage, but I don’t see why you’d ever need 2tb and if you do you can just put the HDD in RAID

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:37, topic:520158”][quote author=marcbob link=topic=638651.msg4305396#msg4305396 date=1369695549]
I’m not finding much at a reasonable price searching on my own, and that sounds very expensive CJ
[/quote]
Well your personal requirements are pretty high what do you expect?

A GTX 650 is not going to be enough if you want this on ultra, especially if you want 60FPS+
Edit: here, @ 1920x1080 the GTX 650 gets an average of 41FPS on the low preset.

Tom's Hardware – 13 Sep 12

Benchmark Results: Battlefield 3 - Nvidia GeForce GTX 650 And 660 Review: Kepler...

Sub-$150 cards like the GeForce GTX 650 can only handle Battlefield 3's Low detail preset, which is a little disappointing. The resulting image quality still looks good, though, and is at least intensive enough to tax these boards. AMD's Radeo...

Honestly, go look at the game benchmarks…

Trust me BF3 is pretty much the only game I play, I have a GTX 680 and I average 90 FPS on ultra @ 1920x1080[/quote]
All the videos I saw of the GTX 650 were playing it on Ultra and 1080p and the 650 is much cheaper, so those 3 options I listed were all able to play on Ultra 1080p, but I really don’t know which one to get of those 3.

EDIT: Lol one of the ones I already listed is out of stock -.-

Prolly gonna go with this one http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

The 660 Ti has such a small bus! The 560 Ti is 25% wider, and the 560 Ti 448 is almost double the width of the 660.

Sub-$150 cards like the GeForce GTX 650 can only handle Battlefield 3's Low detail preset, which is a little disappointing. The resulting image quality still looks good, though, and is at least intensive enough to tax these boards. AMD's Radeo...

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

I would pick up a SSD. It doesn’t really affect gaming but for fucks sake after switching to one I never want to go back to a mechanical hard drive again! The boot time alone is worth the $100 your gonna have to shell out to get one

Read full topic

item.title: Gaming Desktop
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Loveandpower, post:34, topic:520158”]There is absolutely nothing wrong with BestBuy lol…if anything I prefer to buy from them because of the great financing opportunities and the fairly great special offers you can get at the same time. (When I purchased my tv for example I got two free 50$ glasses to go with it for free)

@the computer you posted link to. It is an excellent stock computer keep in mind though as stated earlier if you buy a revolt of any version from IBUYPOWER don’t expect to be able to upgrade so easily.[/quote]
Well I’m not looking to really modify it too much but I’ll keep that in mind. I’d prefer it if I could get a cheaper one but I may have to go with that one

EDIT:
Both of these seem to be able to play BF3 on Ultra and the first is $100 cheaper. Is it worth spending the extra $100 or no?
1st Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883227461
2nd Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883227460

Also the first one has 1TB hard drive compared to 500GB in the second, and the first has i7 compared to i5 in the second. And the first is $100 cheaper!? Am I missing something lol?

3rd Option: http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16883229439
-16gb ram, 2tb harddrive, and good processor at 4.0GHz, except it is AMD

Read full topic
